t: Luke 21
And*p he looked up, and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury.
And*p he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.
And*p he said, Of*r a*r truth*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r that*r this*r poor*r widow*r hath*r cast*r in*r more*r than*r they*r all:*r
For*rp all*r these*r have*r of*r their*r abundance*r cast*r in*r unto*r the*r offerings*r of*r God:*r but*r she*r of*r her*r penury*r hath*r cast*r in*r all*r the*r living*r that*r she*r had.*r
And*p as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said,

As*rp for*r these*r things*r which*r ye*r behold,*r the*r days*r will*r come,*r in*r the*r which*r there*r shall*r not*r be*r left*r one*r stone*r upon*r another,*r that*r shall*r not*r be*r thrown*r down.*r
And*p they asked him, saying, Master, but when shall these things be? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass?

And*p he said, Take*r heed*r that*r ye*r be*r not*r deceived:*r for*r many*r shall*r come*r in*r my*r name,*r saying,*r I*r am*r Christ;*r and*r the*r time*r draweth*r near:*r go*r ye*r not*r therefore*r after*r them.*r
But*rp when*r ye*r shall*r hear*r of*r wars*r and*r commotions,*r be*r not*r terrified:*r for*r these*r things*r must*r first*r come*r to*r pass;*r but*r the*r end*r is*r not*r by*r and*r by.*r
Then*p said he unto them, Nation*r shall*r rise*r against*r nation,*r and*r kingdom*r against*r kingdom:*r
And*rp great*r earthquakes*r shall*r be*r in*r divers*r places,*r and*r famines,*r and*r pestilences;*r and*r fearful*r sights*r and*r great*r signs*r shall*r there*r be*r from*r heaven.*r

But*rp before*r all*r these,*r they*r shall*r lay*r their*r hands*r on*r you,*r and*r persecute*r you,*r delivering*r you*r up*r to*r the*r synagogues,*r and*r into*r prisons,*r being*r brought*r before*r kings*r and*r rulers*r for*r my*r name's*r sake.*r
And*rp it*r shall*r turn*r to*r you*r for*r a*r testimony.*r
Settle*rp it*r therefore*r in*r your*r hearts,*r not*r to*r meditate*r before*r what*r ye*r shall*r answer:*r
For*rp I*r will*r give*r you*r a*r mouth*r and*r wisdom,*r which*r all*r your*r adversaries*r shall*r not*r be*r able*r to*r gainsay*r nor*r resist.*r
And*rp ye*r shall*r be*r betrayed*r both*r by*r parents,*r and*r brethren,*r and*r kinsfolks,*r and*r friends;*r and*r some*r of*r you*r shall*r they*r cause*r to*r be*r put*r to*r death.*r
And*rp ye*r shall*r be*r hated*r of*r all*r men*r for*r my*r name's*r sake.*r
But*rp there*r shall*r not*r an*r hair*r of*r your*r head*r perish.*r
In*rp your*r patience*r possess*r ye*r your*r souls.*r
And*rp when*r ye*r shall*r see*r Jerusalem*r compassed*r with*r armies,*r then*r know*r that*r the*r desolation*r thereof*r is*r nigh.*r

Then*rp let*r them*r which*r are*r in*r Judaea*r flee*r to*r the*r mountains;*r and*r let*r them*r which*r are*r in*r the*r midst*r of*r it*r depart*r out;*r and*r let*r not*r them*r that*r are*r in*r the*r countries*r enter*r thereinto.*r
For*rp these*r be*r the*r days*r of*r vengeance,*r that*r all*r things*r which*r are*r written*r may*r be*r fulfilled.*r

But*rp woe*r unto*r them*r that*r are*r with*r child,*r and*r to*r them*r that*r give*r suck,*r in*r those*r days!*r for*r there*r shall*r be*r great*r distress*r in*r the*r land,*r and*r wrath*r upon*r this*r people.*r

And*rp they*r shall*r fall*r by*r the*r edge*r of*r the*r sword,*r and*r shall*r be*r led*r away*r captive*r into*r all*r nations:*r and*r Jerusalem*r shall*r be*r trodden*r down*r of*r the*r Gentiles,*r until*r the*r times*r of*r the*r Gentiles*r be*r fulfilled.*r

And*rp there*r shall*r be*r signs*r in*r the*r sun,*r and*r in*r the*r moon,*r and*r in*r the*r stars;*r and*r upon*r the*r earth*r distress*r of*r nations,*r with*r perplexity;*r the*r sea*r and*r the*r waves*r roaring;*r
Men's*rp hearts*r failing*r them*r for*r fear,*r and*r for*r looking*r after*r those*r things*r which*r are*r coming*r on*r the*r earth:*r for*r the*r powers*r of*r heaven*r shall*r be*r shaken.*r
And*rp then*r shall*r they*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r coming*r in*r a*r cloud*r with*r power*r and*r great*r glory.*r
And*rp when*r these*r things*r begin*r to*r come*r to*r pass,*r then*r look*r up,*r and*r lift*r up*r your*r heads;*r for*r your*r redemption*r draweth*r nigh.*r
And*p he spake to them a parable; Behold*r the*r fig*r tree,*r and*r all*r the*r trees;*r
When*rp they*r now*r shoot*r forth,*r ye*r see*r and*r know*r of*r your*r own*r selves*r that*r summer*r is*r now*r nigh*r at*r hand.*r
So*rp likewise*r ye,*r when*r ye*r see*r these*r things*r come*r to*r pass,*r know*r ye*r that*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r nigh*r at*r hand.*r
Verily*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r This*r generation*r shall*r not*r pass*r away,*r till*r all*r be*r fulfilled.*r
Heaven*rp and*r earth*r shall*r pass*r away:*r but*r my*r words*r shall*r not*r pass*r away.*r

And*rp take*r heed*r to*r yourselves,*r lest*r at*r any*r time*r your*r hearts*r be*r overcharged*r with*r surfeiting,*r and*r drunkenness,*r and*r cares*r of*r this*r life,*r and*r so*r that*r day*r come*r upon*r you*r unawares.*r
For*rp as*r a*r snare*r shall*r it*r come*r on*r all*r them*r that*r dwell*r on*r the*r face*r of*r the*r whole*r earth.*r

Watch*rp ye*r therefore,*r and*r pray*r always,*r that*r ye*r may*r be*r accounted*r worthy*r to*r escape*r all*r these*r things*r that*r shall*r come*r to*r pass,*r and*r to*r stand*r before*r the*r Son*r of*r man.*r
And*p in the day time he was teaching in the temple; and at night he went out, and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives.
And*p all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, for to hear him.
